intro: Chamaecrista conferta var. gurgueiana, commonly known as the Gurgueian ticktrefoil, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules. Its growth habit is generally low and sprawling, making it a hardy species adapted to arid conditions.
